Article title: Spokesman of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council Made a Statement on the Violent Incident of Storming the Legislative Council in Hong Kong

Article text: On 2 July, the Spokesman of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council issued a statement regarding the violent storm at the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong SAR, expressing his firm support to the HKSAR Government and the police in handling the incident in accordance with the law, and investigating the perpetrators of the violence and holding them criminally responsible in accordance with the law.

The spokesman said that on July 1, the day when people from all walks of life in Hong Kong commemorated Hong Kong's return to the motherland and the establishment of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, some extremist radicals stormed the Legislative Council building in an extremely violent manner and deliberately damaged the Legislative Council's facilities under the pretext of opposing the review of the law by the SAR government. Such serious offences trample on Hong Kong's rule of law, destroy Hong Kong's social order, damage Hong Kong's fundamental interests, and are a blatant challenge to the principle of "one country, two systems".

The spokesman said that the Central Government resolutely supports the HKSAR Government and the police in discharging their responsibilities in accordance with the law, and supports the respective HKSAR authorities in prosecuting the criminal responsibility of the perpetrators of violence in accordance with the law, in order to restore the normal social order of the society as soon as possible, protect the personal safety and property of the citizens, and maintain the prosperity and stability of Hong Kong.
